sentences.sContent: No, I had it when I walked out the door. Dad picked me up to drive me to karate.
sentences.sContent_eng: No, I had it when I walked out the door. Dad picked me up to drive me to karate.
sentences.sCn: 不可能，我出门的时候还带着，爸爸开车接我去上空手道的课，然后我把书包放在车里。

sentences.sContent: Generally you exhale on the effort, if, say, doing weights, karate or boxing, and inhale on the “return”.
sentences.sContent_eng: Generally you exhale on the effort, if, say, doing weights, karate or boxing, and inhale on the “return”.
sentences.sCn: 一般来说，如果你在练哑铃、空手道或拳击，你呼出的是努力，吸入的是“回报”。

trans.tranCn: [日] 空手道(日本的一种徒手自卫武术)
trans.tranOther: a Japanese fighting sport, in which you use your feet and hands to hit and kick
